column4: I have found an ISO for Vista and I need to burn it to a DVD. I've tried Brasseo and Gnomebaker but neither one will make it bootable. Is there a command to burn it from terminal so I can burn it as a bootable disk?
"growisofs -dvd-compat -Z /dev/dvd=image.iso" on the last part, do I have to give where the iso is located?
just once for clarification the command would read; growisofs -dvd-compat -Z /dev/dvd=/home/bryar/WindowsVistaHomePremium.iso
burnt properly. am going to check if it will work.
do you know how to fix?
will try XP and then download Nero... Option for boot there.
not if you burn an iso
either way i end up with frizzbees
too pricey. and my stepmom has all of them
